documents.title: Introduction
documents.summary: This document introduces mitmproxy, a suite of interactive proxy tools for intercepting and modifying HTTP/1, HTTP/2, and WebSocket traffic with SSL/TLS support.

documents.title: Installation
documents.summary: This document explains how to install mitmproxy across various platforms including macOS, Linux, and Windows, with options for Homebrew, package managers, and Docker images.

documents.title: Features
documents.summary: This document explains mitmproxy's various proxy modification features including request blocking, caching control, request/response mapping, body and header modification, authentication handling, and replay capabilities.

documents.title: Getting Started
documents.summary: This guide explains how to start and configure mitmproxy and verify its functionality for intercepting and inspecting web traffic.

documents.title: User Interface
documents.summary: This is a comprehensive documentation index for mitmproxy, covering installation, tutorials for both web and CLI interfaces, core concepts, addon development, API references, and various howto guides for network proxying scenarios.

documents.title: Modify Requests
documents.summary: This tutorial demonstrates how to modify intercepted HTTP requests in mitmproxy before forwarding them to their destination.

documents.title: Intercept Traffic
documents.summary: This is the comprehensive documentation site for mitmproxy, covering installation, tutorials for both web and CLI interfaces, core concepts, addon development, API reference, and practical how-to guides.

documents.title: User Interface
documents.summary: This tutorial teaches users how to navigate and use mitmproxy's text-based user interface, including viewing flows, using keyboard shortcuts, and executing commands.

documents.title: Options
documents.summary: This document explains mitmproxy's options mechanism, a comprehensive system for controlling the tool's behavior through YAML configuration files, command-line flags, and interactive editors.

documents.title: How mitmproxy works
documents.summary: This document explains mitmproxy's proxy mechanisms in detail, covering both explicit and transparent proxying including TLS interception techniques.

documents.title: Filter expressions
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive reference for using filter expressions in mitmproxy to match, select, and filter network flows based on various criteria like URL, headers, body content, response codes, and more.

documents.title: mitmproxy.addonmanager
documents.summary: This module implements an addon management system for mitmproxy that handles addon registration, lifecycle events, and configuration management through the AddonManager class.

documents.title: Custom Options
documents.summary: This document explains how to create and manage options in mitmproxy addons using the Loader API, including setting up typed options, handling configuration updates, and working with different supported types.

documents.title: mitmproxy.http
documents.summary: This document defines the Headers class and MessageData dataclass for handling HTTP message metadata in mitmproxy, including header parsing, content type handling, and serialization functionality.

documents.title: mitmproxy.websocket
documents.summary: This module defines classes for WebSocketMessage and WebSocketData, representing WebSocket messages and connections within HTTP flows in mitmproxy.

documents.title: mitmproxy.dns
documents.summary: This document defines DNS data structures and utilities for handling DNS messages, resource records, and related operations in mitmproxy.

documents.title: Proxy Modes
documents.summary: This guide explains the various proxy modes available in mitmproxy and how to configure them for different capture scenarios.

documents.title: mitmproxy.flow
documents.summary: This document defines the base Flow class and Error class for mitmproxy, which represent network flows and protocol errors in proxy communications.

documents.title: mitmproxy.coretypes.multidict
documents.summary: A base abstract class and implementation for a dictionary-like data structure that supports multiple values per key, commonly used for HTTP headers and cookies.

documents.title: Commands
documents.summary: A guide to essential terminal commands and their usage

documents.title: Wireshark and SSL/TLS
documents.summary: This guide explains how to enable SSL/TLS master key logging in mitmproxy so that Wireshark and other programs can decrypt SSL/TLS traffic.

documents.title: mitmproxy.connection
documents.summary: Defines data classes for representing client and server connections in the mitmproxy proxy framework, including connection state, TLS details, and metadata.

documents.title: Intercept Requests
documents.summary: This tutorial explains how to intercept and selectively capture requests in mitmproxy using the intercept command and flow filter expressions.

documents.title: mitmproxy.udp
documents.summary: This document defines the UDPFlow and UDPMessage classes that represent UDP sessions and individual datagrams in the mitmproxy framework.

documents.title: Ignoring Domains
documents.summary: This guide explains how to configure mitmproxy to exempt specific domains from interception using the ignore_hosts option and regular expressions.

documents.title: Setting highscores on Apple GameCenter
documents.summary: This tutorial demonstrates how to use mitmproxy to intercept and modify Apple Game Center score submissions, showing how to craft custom requests and replay them.

documents.title: mitmproxy.proxy.server_hooks
documents.summary: This document defines data classes and hooks for handling server connection events in mitmproxy, including events for when a server connects, disconnects, or encounters errors.

documents.title: Event Hooks
documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive reference guide to mitmproxy's addon event hooks across various protocol layers including lifecycle, connection, HTTP, DNS, TCP, UDP, QUIC, TLS, WebSocket, and SOCKS5 events.

documents.title: mitmproxy.certs
documents.summary: This document provides a Python class for representing and manipulating TLS certificates in the mitmproxy framework, including certificate serialization and inspection methods.

documents.title: Custom Contentviews
documents.summary: This document explains how to create custom contentviews in mitmproxy to pretty-print binary data and provides examples of implementing both simple and interactive contentviews.

documents.title: Certificates
documents.summary: This guide explains how to install and configure mitmproxy's certificate authority for intercepting HTTPS traffic, including quick setup instructions and manual installation methods for various platforms.

documents.title: mitmproxy.contentviews
documents.summary: Provides a protocol for content views in mitmproxy that format, decode, highlight, and reencode data for display, including HTTP message bodies and WebSocket messages.

documents.title: mitmproxy.tcp
documents.summary: This document defines TCPMessage and TCPFlow classes for representing TCP traffic in mitmproxy, including message direction, content, timestamps, and serialization.

documents.title: mitmproxy.proxy.mode_specs
documents.summary: This module defines a base ProxyMode class and implements various proxy mode types including regular, transparent, upstream, reverse, and SOCKS modes, each with specific parsing logic and validation.

documents.title: Examples
documents.summary: Collection of example mitmproxy addons demonstrating various functionality including HTTP manipulation, command handling, options, and content view customization.

documents.title: mitmproxy.net.server_spec
documents.summary: Defines a ServerSpec type and parse function for converting server mode strings into tuples of scheme and host-port pairs.

documents.title: System CA on Android Emulator
documents.summary: This guide explains how to install the mitmproxy CA certificate on an Android emulator by placing it in the system certificate store.

documents.title: Analyze Flows
documents.summary: This is the official documentation index for mitmproxy, covering installation, tutorials, core concepts, addon development, API reference, and HOWTO guides for HTTP and SSL/TLS proxying.

documents.title: Transparently Proxying VMs
documents.summary: This guide provides step-by-step instructions for setting up transparent proxying on virtual machines using mitmproxy, including network configuration, DHCP setup with dnsmasq, and traffic redirection.

documents.title: Protocols
documents.summary: This document describes the supported web protocols in mitmproxy, including HTTP/1, HTTP/2, HTTP/3, WebSocket, DNS, TCP, and TLS proxy capabilities along with their known limitations.

documents.title: Overview
documents.summary: This guide explains how to create mitmproxy addons using the event-based programming model, including the anatomy of a basic addon, abbreviated scripting syntax, and how addons interact with mitmproxy through events, options, and commands.

documents.title: Modify Requests
documents.summary: This is the official documentation site for mitmproxy, covering installation, tutorials for both web and CLI interfaces, core concepts, addon development, API references, and various configuration guides and HOWTOs.

documents.title: Replay Flows
documents.summary: This is the official documentation website for mitmproxy, a free and open-source interactive HTTPS proxy platform for inspecting HTTP/2, HTTPS, WebSockets, and TCP traffic.

documents.title: What's Next
documents.summary: This tutorial concludes the mitmproxy beginner's course by covering next steps, including configuring browser proxies and referencing additional documentation.

documents.title: Transparent Proxying
documents.summary: This guide explains how to configure and set up transparent proxying for mitmproxy on Linux, OpenBSD, and macOS systems using iptables or pf firewall tools.

documents.title: mitmproxy.tls
documents.summary: This module provides classes for parsing and handling TLS ClientHello messages, including support for SNI, ALPN protocols, cipher suites, and TLS extensions in both standard and DTLS.

documents.title: Custom Commands
documents.summary: A guide explaining how to create and use custom commands in the system, covering syntax, parameters, and examples.

documents.title: Kubernetes Services
documents.summary: A guide to understanding Kubernetes Services and their types including ClusterIP, NodePort, and LoadBalancer services for managing network access to application pods

documents.title: mitmproxy.proxy.context
documents.summary: This document defines the Context class that provides access to client connections, server connections, proxy options, and protocol layer stacks for the mitmproxy proxy core.

documents.title: API Changelog
documents.summary: This page documents breaking API changes and deprecated features in the mitmproxy addon system across multiple versions.

documents.title: Client playback: a 30 second example
documents.summary: This document demonstrates client-side playback functionality with a 30-second example, likely showing code samples or implementation steps for integrating audio or video playback.
